definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Men were departing from the word of God, and exalting theories of their own invention.
sentences.chinese: 人們正在偏離上帝的真道，而高舉自己發明的理論。

sentences.english: Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.
sentences.chinese: 要存清潔的良心，固守真道的奧祕。

sentences.english: They will turn their ears away from the truth and turnaside to myths.
sentences.chinese: 並且掩耳不聽真道，偏向荒渺的言語。

sentences.english: Stockton Chinese Christian Church is a non- denominational independent Christian church.
sentences.chinese: 士德頓基督教真道堂是一間不分宗派的獨立教會。

sentences.english: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
sentences.chinese: 不聽猶太人荒渺的言語，和離棄真道之人的誡命。

sentences.english: He simprove I i am the only way to true life.
sentences.chinese: 他說我是生命獨一的真道。

sentences.english: The Holy Spirit was so imparted to his hearers that they received the Word "with joy of the Holy Ghost."
sentences.chinese: 聖靈樂意將那屬天的喜樂，分給那願意領受真道的人。

sentences.english: Though the world fall, yet the Christian is to proclaim and defend the Faith.
sentences.chinese: 儘管世人都要跌倒，但基督徒要宣告和捍衛真道。

sentences.english: They are the standard of character, the revealer of doctrines, and the test of experience.
sentences.chinese: 它是品格的標準，真道的啓示者和經驗的試金石。

sentences.english: Aya Shindo is an artist drawing unique worlds with a distinctive use of color.
sentences.chinese: 真道彩以獨特的色彩繪畫創作。

definition: to lecture on doctrine/to expound the wisdom of ancient sages/to preach/a sermon
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
to maintain/to adhere to/to observe (an injunction etc)
variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
lit. true religion/orthodox religion/orthodox Christianity/Islam (in the writing of Chinese or Hui theologians)
